Issues Climate change is drastically affecting the habitats of many endangered species around the world.
Polar Bears

Arctic sea ice declines by 13% per decade, shrinking vital hunting grounds.

Penguins

Some penguin colonies have dropped by over 60% in 50 years due to melting ice and scarce food.

Rhino

Black rhinos declined by over 97% from 1960 to 1995, as erratic rainfall disrupts food sources.

Tiger

Up to 70% of the Sundarbans could be underwater by 2070, endangering Bengal tiger breeding grounds.

Orangutan

Over 80% of orangutan habitat in Borneo may vanish by 2080 due to droughts and deforestation.

Sea Turtle

Rising sand temperatures produce up to 99% female hatchlings, risking future population balances.

Koala

In 2020, bushfires wiped out up to 70% of some koala populations. Heatwaves also reduce the moisture in eucalyptus leaves, their main food.

Elephant

Longer droughts reduce water availability and grazing lands, pushing elephants closer to human areas and increasing conflict.
